intro: Licaria trinervis, commonly known as the three-veined licaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with three primary veins, giving it its common name. Its small, white flowers are typically arranged in clusters and bloom during the wet season. Licaria trinervis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
